Generate release notes based on the commits and merged pull requests since the last release (or since the specified date or tag).

Organize the output into sections:

## Release Notes — [version or date range]

### New Features
[PRs and commits that add new functionality]

### Improvements
[PRs and commits that enhance existing functionality]

### Bug Fixes
[PRs and commits that fix reported issues]

### Accessibility
[PRs and commits that specifically address accessibility — screen reader support, keyboard navigation, heading structure, ARIA, color contrast, etc. Always include this section if any accessibility-related changes exist.]

### Documentation
[PRs and commits that update docs, guides, or examples]

### Maintenance
[Dependency updates, CI changes, internal refactoring]

Rules:

  • Each item: one sentence, present tense ("Adds support for...", "Fixes keyboard trap in...")
  • Credit contributors: "Contributed by @username" after each item
  • Link to the PR or commit for each item using descriptive link text
  • Do not include merge commits, automated dependency bumps in the main sections (put them in Maintenance)
  • If a section has no items, omit it — except Accessibility, which should always appear if there are contributing changes
